SEARCH
Package com.pds.curiousmind.model.library

Interface Library<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects managed by the library
All Known Implementing Classes:
CourseLibrary, UserLibrary
public interface Library<T>
Interface for a generic library that manages objects of a specific type.

This interface defines the contract for a library that can add, remove, update, and retrieve objects of type T. It is intended to be implemented by classes that manage collections of domain objects, such as users, courses, or other entities.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Add new objects to the library.
  • Remove existing objects from the library.
  • Update objects in the library.
  • Retrieve all objects managed by the library.
  • Retrieve a specific object by its unique identifier.

Type Parameters:

  • T - the type of objects managed by the library

Usage Example:

     Library<User> userLibrary = new UserLibrary();
     User user = new User("Alice");
     userLibrary.add(user);
     List<User> allUsers = userLibrary.getAll();
     User found = userLibrary.getById(1L);
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • add

      T add(T object)
      Adds a new object to the library.
      Parameters:
      object - the object to add
      Returns:
      the added object (may be the same or a persisted version)

    • remove

      boolean remove(T object)
      Removes an object from the library.
      Parameters:
      object - the object to remove
      Returns:
      true if the object was removed, false otherwise

    • update

      T update(T object)
      Updates an existing object in the library.
      Parameters:
      object - the object to update
      Returns:
      the updated object

    • getAll

      List<T> getAll()
      Retrieves all objects managed by the library.
      Returns:
      a list of all objects in the library

    • getById

      T getById(Long id)
      Retrieves an object by its unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the object
      Returns:
      the object with the specified id, or null if not found
